title: Law establishing the Infrastructure Development Levy on Imported Goods
title_en: Law establishing the Infrastructure Development Levy on Imported Goods

provisions.title: Article One – Purpose of this Law
provisions.content: This Law establishes the infrastructure development levy on imported goods.

provisions.title: Article 2 – Scope of application of this Law
provisions.content: This Law shall apply to all imported goods. It shall not apply to imported goods exempted under this Law.

provisions.title: Article 3 – Definitions of terms
provisions.content: For the purpose of this Law, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 1º levy: the charge on imported goods aiming at promoting regional infrastructure development; 2º goods: tangible or intangible property, but does not include money and negotiable instruments; 3º customs legislation: East African Community Customs Management Act; 4º Commissioner General: the Commissioner General of Rwanda Revenue Authority.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Rate and base of the levy and exempted goods
provisions.title: Article 4 – Rate and base of the levy
provisions.content: All imported goods shall be subject to a levy of one and half per cent (1.5%) to be levied on the customs value of imported goods.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Rate and base of the levy and exempted goods
provisions.title: Article 5 – Exempted goods
provisions.content: The following goods shall be exempted from the levy: 1º goods imported certifying the East African Community Rules of Origin; 2º goods imported specified in the Fifth Schedule of the East African Customs Management Act as appended to this Law; 3º imported goods exempted from taxes as provided for in East African Community and industrial goods imported in Rwanda entitled to remission; 4º reproductive animals and reproductive plants; 5º pharmaceutical products; 6º veterinary and phytosanitary products; 7º medical equipment appearing on the list made by the Minister in charge of health and approved by the Minister in charge of taxes; 8º veterinary and phytosanitary equipment appearing on the list made by the Minister in charge of agriculture and animal husbandry and approved by the Minister in charge of taxes; 9º industrial machinery and equipment for energy and water sectors, as well as for investment projects with investment certificate; 10º organic and inorganic chemicals; 11º machinery and equipment approved by the Commissioner General.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Collection and management of the levy
provisions.title: Article 6 – Collection of the levy
provisions.content: The levy on goods imported shall be collected at the customs point in accordance with the customs legislation.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Collection and management of the levy
provisions.title: Article 7 – Management of the levy
provisions.content: The levy on goods imported shall be deposited into a sub account of the Public Treasury Single Account.

provisions.title: Article 8 – Drafting, consideration and adoption of this Law
provisions.content: This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Kinyarwanda

provisions.title: Article 9 – Repealing provision
provisions.content: All prior legal provisions contrary to this Law are hereby repealed.

provisions.title: Article 10 – Commencement
provisions.content: This Law shall come into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda.
